title: Drones could fix Scottish wind farms without human help
text:
Wind farms in remote locations could soon be manned by a team of autonomous robots that can fly, swim, walk and attach themselves to vertical surfaces using robotic arms.

A team of Scottish scientists has developed a series of robots that can repair and inspect equipment autonomously as part of a multi-million pound project.

A drone equipped with a robotic arm can attach itself to vertical structures, such as a wind turbine, to inspect it, hook on a sensor or carry out reparations independently.

Researchers are also trialing aquatic robots can swim underwater without cables and perform maintenance tasks on submerged structures.
